member.name: F:JetBrains.Platform.VisualStudio.SinceVs16.Shell.Actions.VsReSharperMainMenuFixesSinceVs16.InstanceIdPropertyName
member.summary: We need to identify VS menu items. Text is not a reliable way to do that. The natural identifier is CommandID, but menu item does not expose it. To match CommandID to menu item we use InstanceID property of IVsUIDataSource, which is stored in the menu item's DataContext. Using DTE we found InstanceID by CommandID (see ), and than use it to match menu items.

member.summary: The collection of asynchronous tasks started by this package.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Platform.VisualStudio.SinceVs16.Shell.Package.VsAsyncPackage.JoinableTaskFactory
member.summary: Gets the factory to use for asynchronous tasks started by this package.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Platform.VisualStudio.SinceVs16.Shell.Package.VsAsyncPackage.DisposalToken
member.summary: Exposes a CancellationToken that can be used to check if the package has been disposed. This can happen for asynchronous tasks that are running on a background thread when Visual Studio has started to shut down.
Initializes the package. Provides a way get access to IAsyncServiceProvider and IProfferAsyncService without needing to use IServiceProvider.
member.param: Provides a way to register a provider for services that can be retrieved asynchronously. Similar to IProfferService.
Provides a way for asynchronous service and package owners to report progress.

member.param: True not to report exceptions (except critical ones).

member.name: M:JetBrains.Platform.VisualStudio.SinceVs16.Shell.Package.VsAsyncPackage.Microsoft#VisualStudio#Shell#Interop#IVsAsyncToolWindowFactoryProvider#GetAsyncToolWindowFactory(System.Guid)
member.summary: Returns the asynchronous tool window factory interface for the tool window identified by , if asynchronous creation is supported for the tool window. If asynchronous creation is not supported, null is returned.
member.param: Type of the window to be created
member.returns: The asynchronous factory interface, or null if not supported
